case_title: GOVERNMENT OF N.W.F.P. THROUGH HOME SECRETARY Ama 2 OTHERS vs KHIZAR HAYAT AND ANOTHER
appellant: GOVERNMENT OF N.W.F.P. THROUGH HOME SECRETARY Ama 2 OTHERS

key_points.amnesty_order_effect: Commutation of death sentences to imprisonment for life for cases pending execution.
key_points.high_court_confirmation: Death sentences confirmed by High Court before Amnesty Order were deemed pending execution and commuted.
key_points.supreme_court_cases: Cases pending in Supreme Court were also eligible for commutation under Amnesty Order.
key_points.ordinary_criminal_courts: Amnesty Order applied to sentences from ordinary criminal courts, excluding military or martial law courts.

precedents_cited.case_name: K. M. Nanavati v. The State of Bombay
Falak Sher and others v. The State
Doso alias Dost Muhammad and another v. The State

judgment_summary: The review applications were dismissed as the Amnesty Order unambiguously commuted death sentences confirmed by High Court before its notification to life imprisonment, regardless of subsequent appeals to Supreme Court. The argument that Supreme Court cases were excluded from the Amnesty Order was rejected.
